kubernetes_priority_class.description: A PriorityClass is a non-namespaced object that defines a mapping from a priority class name to the integer value of the priority.

metadata.description: Standard resource quota's metadata. For more info see [Kubernetes reference](https://github.com/kubernetes/community/blob/master/contributors/devel/sig-architecture/api-conventions.md#metadata)

value.description: The value of this priority class. This is the actual priority that pods receive when they have the name of this class in their pod spec.

description.description: An arbitrary string that usually provides guidelines on when this priority class should be used.

global_default.description: Boolean that specifies whether this PriorityClass should be considered as the default priority for pods that do not have any priority class.
